name: Hydrogen
info: Atomic Number: 1. Lightest element, colorless gas, used in rocket fuel and the Sun's fusion.

name: Lithium
info: Atomic Number: 3. Soft metal, used in rechargeable batteries.

name: Sodium
info: Atomic Number: 11. Soft, silvery metal, highly reactive with water, used in table salt.

name: Potassium
info: Atomic Number: 19. Soft, silvery metal, essential for life, used in fertilizers.

name: Rubidium
info: Atomic Number: 37. Soft, silvery-white metallic element, highly reactive.

name: Caesium
info: Atomic Number: 55. Soft, gold-colored metal, used in atomic clocks.

name: Francium
info: Atomic Number: 87. Extremely rare and radioactive alkali metal.

name: Beryllium
info: Atomic Number: 4. Strong, lightweight metal, used in aerospace and military applications.

name: Magnesium
info: Atomic Number: 12. Lightweight metal, used in alloys and fireworks.

name: Calcium
info: Atomic Number: 20. Essential for bones and teeth, used in cement and lime.

name: Strontium
info: Atomic Number: 38. Soft, silvery metal, used in fireworks and magnets.

name: Barium
info: Atomic Number: 56. Soft, silvery metal, used in X-ray imaging.

name: Radium
info: Atomic Number: 88. Radioactive, used in luminous paints (historically).

name: Chromium
info: Atomic Number: 24. Used in stainless steel and chrome plating.

name: Manganese
info: Atomic Number: 25. Used in steel production and batteries.

name: Iron
info: Atomic Number: 26. Used in construction, machinery, and is essential for blood (hemoglobin).

name: Cobalt
info: Atomic Number: 27. Used in magnets, batteries, and blue pigments.

name: Nickel
info: Atomic Number: 28. Used in coins, stainless steel, and batteries.

name: Copper
info: Atomic Number: 29. Excellent conductor, used in electrical wiring and coins.

name: Zinc
info: Atomic Number: 30. Used for galvanizing iron, in batteries, and as a dietary supplement.

name: Silver
info: Atomic Number: 47. Precious metal, used in jewelry, coins, and electronics.

name: Cadmium
info: Atomic Number: 48. Used in batteries and pigments, toxic heavy metal.

name: Platinum
info: Atomic Number: 78. Precious metal, used in catalytic converters and jewelry.

name: Gold
info: Atomic Number: 79. Precious metal, used in jewelry, electronics, and as a standard for currency.

name: Mercury
info: Atomic Number: 80. Only liquid metal at room temperature, used in thermometers and fluorescent lamps.

name: Aluminum
info: Atomic Number: 13. Lightweight, corrosion-resistant metal, used in cans and aircraft.

name: Gallium
info: Atomic Number: 31. Melts in your hand, used in electronics and LEDs.

name: Carbon
info: Atomic Number: 6. Fundamental building block of life, found in diamonds and graphite.

name: Nitrogen
info: Atomic Number: 7. Colorless, odorless gas, makes up 78% of Earth's atmosphere.

name: Oxygen
info: Atomic Number: 8. Essential for respiration, reactive element, supports combustion.

name: Phosphorus
info: Atomic Number: 15. Essential for life, used in fertilizers and DNA.

name: Sulfur
info: Atomic Number: 16. Yellow solid, used in fertilizers and gunpowder.

name: Selenium
info: Atomic Number: 34. Used in glassmaking and electronics, essential trace element.

name: Boron
info: Atomic Number: 5. Metalloid, used in glass and ceramics, enhances strength and heat resistance.

name: Silicon
info: Atomic Number: 14. Semiconductor, used in electronics and solar cells.

name: Germanium
info: Atomic Number: 32. Used in semiconductors and fiber optics.

name: Arsenic
info: Atomic Number: 33. Poisonous metalloid, used in pesticides and semiconductors.

name: Antimony
info: Atomic Number: 51. Used in flame retardants and alloys.

name: Tellurium
info: Atomic Number: 52. Used in alloys and solar panels.

name: Fluorine
info: Atomic Number: 9. Highly reactive, used in toothpaste and Teflon.

name: Chlorine
info: Atomic Number: 17. Greenish-yellow gas, used in disinfectants and bleach.

name: Bromine
info: Atomic Number: 35. Reddish-brown liquid, used in flame retardants.

name: Iodine
info: Atomic Number: 53. Purple-black solid, essential for thyroid health.

name: Astatine
info: Atomic Number: 85. Rare, radioactive halogen.

name: Helium
info: Atomic Number: 2. Noble gas, inert, used in balloons and cooling superconducting magnets.

name: Neon
info: Atomic Number: 10. Noble gas, emits red-orange glow, used in neon signs.

name: Argon
info: Atomic Number: 18. Noble gas, inert, used in light bulbs and welding.

name: Krypton
info: Atomic Number: 36. Noble gas, used in lighting and photography.

name: Xenon
info: Atomic Number: 54. Noble gas, used in lamps and anesthesia.

name: Radon
info: Atomic Number: 86. Radioactive noble gas, health hazard in homes.
